Navigation
Name Rascal/Expressions/Values/Number/abs

Synopsis Absolute value of a numeric value.
Function &T <: num abs(&T <: num n)
Description Absolute value of the number n. The result type is equal to the type of the argument n.
Examples 
rascal>import Number;
ok
rascal>abs(13)
int: 13
rascal>abs(-13)
int: 13
rascal>abs(3.14)
real: 3.14
rascal>abs(-3.14)
real: 3.14
Questions
Question 1.
The type of abs(-19) is

Question 2.
The type of abs(14.21097672307776800) is

Question 3. 
abs(-14) ==

Question 4. 
abs(-10.792710013486874870) ==
